context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: US-bound passengers face new security interviews at check-in
context_meta.summary: US-bound travelers will face security interviews before checking in to flights at a number of global airlines beginning Thursday as anti-terror measures are stepped up around the world. Lufthansa, Emirates, Air France and Norwegian Air confirmed to AFP Wednesday that US authorities had asked for tougher controls at departure airports for non-stop flights to the United States. "In addition to the controls of electronic devices already introduced, travelers to the USA might now also face short interviews at check-in, document check or gate," a Lufthansa spokesperson said.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: US-bound passengers face new security interviews at check-in
context_meta.summary: US-bound travelers will face security interviews before checking in to flights at a number of global airlines beginning Thursday as anti-terror measures are stepped up around the world. Lufthansa, Emirates, Air France and Norwegian Air confirmed to AFP Wednesday that US authorities had asked for tougher controls at departure airports for non-stop flights to the United States. "In addition to the controls of electronic devices already introduced, travelers to the USA might now also face short interviews at check-in, document check or gate," a Lufthansa spokesperson said.

Catholic Nuns run around in their garb covered head to toe, but when the bigots see a Muslim with a scarf on her head they pee in their pants. I wonder what these bigoted Christians would do  if they saw Mary, the mother of Christ going around with her head covered in a hijab. Our women shelters are full to capacity and the bigots have the audacity to complain about Muslims abusing their wome. Every day there are stories of children being raped and killed by their Christian families and the Christian morons are worried about Islam, go figure.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: US-bound passengers face new security interviews at check-in
context_meta.summary: US-bound travelers will face security interviews before checking in to flights at a number of global airlines beginning Thursday as anti-terror measures are stepped up around the world. Lufthansa, Emirates, Air France and Norwegian Air confirmed to AFP Wednesday that US authorities had asked for tougher controls at departure airports for non-stop flights to the United States. "In addition to the controls of electronic devices already introduced, travelers to the USA might now also face short interviews at check-in, document check or gate," a Lufthansa spokesperson said.

text: Instead of the bs airport auditions performed by high school graduates, why don't you take everybody's fingerprints and picture instead?

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: US-bound passengers face new security interviews at check-in
context_meta.summary: US-bound travelers will face security interviews before checking in to flights at a number of global airlines beginning Thursday as anti-terror measures are stepped up around the world. Lufthansa, Emirates, Air France and Norwegian Air confirmed to AFP Wednesday that US authorities had asked for tougher controls at departure airports for non-stop flights to the United States. "In addition to the controls of electronic devices already introduced, travelers to the USA might now also face short interviews at check-in, document check or gate," a Lufthansa spokesperson said.

text:
An additional interview = answer yes/no questions (like are you planning to perform terroristic activities ?).
With all these measures (including the debated travel bans) my biggest problem is not their intent or the message they are giving, but that they are completely useless for the intent.
Additional questionnaire ? Pffff, I am not saying anything more about this useless measure.
Travel ban for SOME Islamic countries ? Either the Islamic people (or at least an indiscernible part of them) are the enemy - then I need to block them ALL, and not just some. Or not - then the travel ban is complete nonsense. Either way, it will not help. On the contrary, it just makes more people thinking hostile thoughts increasing the chances that somebody from that "side" tries something stupid. And they can, if they want. The simplest way is to use a different country.
Wall to Mexico ? As existing pieces of walls and fences show - no effect. They dig tunnels. The real garbage from there comes into our country not by just walking across the border in the desert or something like this, but by regularly crossing the border at regular checkpoints, by airplanes, ships and by using these tunnels. That's why I always said, if such a wall wants to have a chance to make any positive impact, it is not important how high it is, but how deep it goes into the ground. Instead of 30 ft high and going 5ft under ground, it would be better to reverse this. To go 30-50ft below to prevent those tunnels. But then they will get real tunnel engineers and build even deeper ones. At least it would really cost them and be painful.
And so on.

So, you see, I am not even talking about the question, if the intent is good or bad. Just by accepting the communicated intent the chosen measures will not help at all. They just cost money and give some people a chance to pretend that they did something to improve our security and/or quality of life.

context_meta.title: House approves legislation to thwart Hezbollah's cash flow
context_meta.summary: WASHINGTON –  The House approved bipartisan legislation Wednesday to block the flow of illicit money to Iran-backed Hezbollah militants and to sanction the group for using civilians as human shields as lawmakers took aim at what they called Tehran's leading terrorist proxy. The measures were approved by voice vote. The bill targeting Hezbollah's finances, sponsored by Reps. Ed Royce and Eliot Engel, directs the Trump administration to sanction the people and businesses engaged in fundraising and recruitment activities for the group. Royce, a California Republican, is chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee and Engel of New York is the panel's top Democrat. Hezbollah is a member of Lebanon's

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: After Irma, four sailboats landed in someone's yard. They're still there.
context_meta.summary: David Ivler never wanted to have a fleet of sailboats, but he's got one now. In his back yard. Ivler is reluctant commodore of the 48-foot, 40-ton, twin-masted, black and gold Coup d'Amour, which looks like a pirate ship, as well as the Sava, the Moin and the Sailing the Wings of Destiny, each about 35 feet long. The four vessels are sandwiched together like books on a shelf at the waterfront end of Ivler's picturesque Coconut Grove property, just beyond his swimming pool. They block his view of Biscayne Bay. They excrete an aroma of sewage, gasoline, rotting food and fetid saltwater. They attract rats. None of the boats are his: They are among the dozens of runaway boats that broke free from

context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: IED attached to drone in Mexico could show evolution of drug cartel tactics
context_meta.summary: The recent arrest in Mexico of four men carrying a drone equipped with an improvised explosive device "ready to be detonated" has stoked fears drug cartels could soon target the U.S. with bombs from above. Mexican Federal Police arrested four men Oct. 20 in Guanajuanto who were driving a stolen vehicle equipped with a 3DR Solo Quadcopter drone attached to an IED, Small Wars Journal reported. The drone had a range of about half a mile, but modifications would have allowed it to fly farther. State Attorney General Carlos Zamarripa Aguirre confirmed the arrests and the IED attached to the drone.
